Mono LCD
Stratify OS » Device Interface

Detailed Description

This is the interface for accessing monochrome LCDs. The driver allows an application to load the video memory pointer as well as the width and height of the device.

When an application accesses the LCD, it must issue a HOLD before modifying the memory and a RELEASE when modification is complete.

int fd;
mlcd_attr_t attr;
fd = open("/dev/lcd0", O_RDWR);
ioctl(fd, I_MCLD_GETATTR, &attr);
ioctl(fd, I_MLCD_HOLD, &attr);
//attr.mem can be directly modified
ioctl(fd, I_MLCD_RELEASE, &attr);
//the display will refresh based on the value of attr.freq (usually in the tens of hertz range)

Enumerations

Variables

u16 mlcd_attr_t::w
 LCD width in pixels.
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::h
 LCD height in pixels.
 
void *   mlcd_attr_t::mem
 A pointer to the shared LCD memory which is mapped to the screen.
 
u8 *   mlcd_attr_t::mem8
 A pointer to shared LCD memory (unsigned char)
 
u32 *   mlcd_attr_t::mem32
 A pointer to shared LCD memory (unsigned 32 bit)
 
void *   mlcd_attr_t::scratch_mem
 A pointer to the shared LCD memory which is mapped to the screen.
 
u8 *   mlcd_attr_t::scratch_mem8
 A pointer to shared LCD memory (unsigned char)
 
u32 *   mlcd_attr_t::scratch_mem32
 A pointer to shared LCD memory (unsigned 32 bit)
 
u32 mlcd_attr_t::size
 The size of mem in bytes (typically w*h/8)
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::cols
 Number of memory 32-bit word columns.
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::rows
 Number of memory rows.
 
u32 mlcd_attr_t::freq
 This value is R/W and specifies how often the screen is refreshed.
 
u8 mlcd_attr_t::hold
 This values specifies the hold count. A non-zero hold count prevents the screen from refreshing.
 
u8 mlcd_attr_t::orientation
 Orientation bitmask.
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::margin_left
 Left margin.
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::margin_right
 Left margin.
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::margin_top
 Left margin.
 
u16 mlcd_attr_t::margin_bottom
 Left margin.
 

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_MLCD_BUSY

Returns non-zero is the LCD is busy

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_BUSY);
#define I_MLCD_CLEAR

This request clears the LCD. This does not affect the video memory. This is only supported on devices that include a way to clear the memory using a hardware command.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_CLEAR);
#define I_MLCD_GETATTR

This request gets the attributes of the device.

Example:

1 mlcd_attr_t attr;
2 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_GETATTR, &attr);
#define I_MLCD_HOLD

This request tells the system not to update the screen because the video memory is currently being modified. This will increment the hold member of mlcd_attr_t (see I_MLCD_GETATTR).

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_HOLD);
#define I_MLCD_INIT

This request initializes the LCD. This request is normally performed by the system meaning an application will not typically call this command.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_INIT);
#define I_MLCD_OFF

This turns off the LCD so that no image is shown.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_OFF);
#define I_MLCD_ON

This turns on the LCD so that an image is shown.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_ON);
#define I_MLCD_TOUCH

This request tells the system that an application has modified the video memory. The new memory will be written to the LCD on the next refresh event.

Example:

1 ioctl(fildes, I_MLCD_TOUCH);

Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum
Enumerator
ORIENT_TOP 

Memory is mapped to the LCD from top (y=0) to bottom.

ORIENT_BOTTOM 

Memory is mapped to the LCD from bottom (y=0) to top.

ORIENT_LEFT 

Memory is mapped to the LCD from left to right.

ORIENT_RIGHT 

Memory is mapped to the LCD from left to right.
